sen.j: 深草駅（ふかくさえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区深草ケナサ町にある、京阪電気鉄道京阪本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Fukakusa-kenasa-cho Fushimi Ward Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture, Fukakusa Station is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Fukakusa Station, located in Fukakusa-kenasa-cho Fushimi Ward Kyoto City Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Fukakusa Station, located in Fukakusa-kenasa-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加しました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 島式2面4線のプラットホームを持つ、待避設備を備えた橋上駅である。
sen.e: It is an over-track station provided with two island platforms serving four tracks and with siding facilities.
It is an over-track station provided with siding facilities and two island platforms serving four tracks.
It is an over-track station provided with siding facilities and two island platforms serving four tracks.

sen.j: 橋上駅舎はホームの出町柳寄りに設けられている。
sen.e: The over-track station house is located on the Demachiyanagi side of the platforms.
The over-track station house is located on the Demachiyanagi side of the platforms.
The over-track station house is located on the Demachiyanagi side of the platforms.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみで、東西に出入口がある。
sen.e: Only one entrance/exit gate place is provided, with an entrance/exit on the east side and on the west side of the station, respectively.
Only one entrance/exit gate is provided, with an entrance/exit on the east side and on the west side of the station, respectively.
Only one ticket gate is provided, with an entrance/exit on the east side and on the west side of the station, respectively.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: この駅のホーム屋根の柱は「深草」に合わせて『深緑色』に塗られている、。
sen.e: The roof and pillars of this station are painted "dark green" corresponding to "Fukakusa (thick grass)."
The roof and pillars of this station are painted dark green, corresponding to "Fukakusa (thick grass)."
The pillars of the roof of this station are painted dark green, corresponding to 'Fukakusa (thick grass).'
sen.cmt: pillars of the roof としました。" → ' としました。

sen.j: かつては深草車庫が併設されていたが、1980年3月の淀車庫の完成により廃止された。
sen.e: In the past, Fukakusa-shako Depot existed beside the station but its use was discontinued after Yodo-shako Depot was constructed.
In the past, Fukakusa-shako Depot existed beside the station; however, its use was discontinued after Yodo-shako Depot was constructed.
In the past, Fukakusa-shako Depot existed beside the station; however, its use was discontinued after Yodo-shako Depot was constructed in March 1980.

sen.j: 西側の跡地は長らく放置されていたが近年になりマンションが建設された。
sen.e: The former depot site, located on the west side of this station, remained vacant for some time, but recently, a condominium has been constructed there.
The former depot site, located on the west side of this station, remained vacant for some time, but recently a condominium was built there.
The former depot site, located on the west side of this station, remained vacant for some time, but recently a condominium was built there.

sen.j: また東側は車庫の廃止時点で留置線が2本残っていたがホーム幅を拡幅するために1線が撤去され、かろうじて留置線1線が残るのみである。
sen.e: When use of the depot on the eastern side was discontinued, two extra side tracks for keeping trains remained but one of them was removed later to expand the platform widths, making only one such extra side track still remain.

When the use of the depot on the eastern side was discontinued, two extra sidetracks for keeping trains remained; however, one of them was later removed in order to expand the platform widths, so that only one extra sidetrack remains.

When the use of the depot on the eastern side was discontinued, two extra sidetracks for keeping trains remained; however, one of them was later removed in order to expand the platform widths, so that only one extra sidetrack remains.

sen.j: のりば
sen.e: Platforms
Platforms
Platforms

sen.j: いずれのホームも有効長は7両分しかないが、線路の有効長は8両分あるので8両編成の回送列車が当駅に停車することは可能。
sen.e: The effective length of each of the platforms is that for seven-car trains, but with the effective lengths of the tracks being those for eight-car trains, deadhead trains can stop at this station.

The effective length of each platform is sufficient to accommodate a seven-car train, but with the effective lengths of the tracks being those for eight-car trains, deadhead trains can stop at this station.

The effective length of each platform is sufficient to accommodate a seven-car train, but with the effective lengths of the tracks being those for eight-car trains, deadhead trains of eight cars can stop at this station.

sen.j: 留置線は8両分。
sen.e: The length of the extra side track for keeping trains is that for eight-car trains.
The length of the extra sidetrack for keeping trains is equal to that of an eight-car train.
The length of the extra sidetrack for keeping trains is equal to that of an eight-car train.

sen.j: 発車メロディが導入されている。
sen.e: A melody is used for notifying a train deaparture.
A melody is used to indicate a train's departure.
A melody is used to indicate a train's departure.

sen.j: 駅構造の項で記したように、かつてこの駅に車庫が併設されていた。
sen.e: As described for the station layout, a depot was once provided beside this station.
As mentioned in regard to the station's structure, a depot was once provided beside the station.
As mentioned in regard to the station layout, a depot was once provided beside the station.

sen.j: その名残からか、列車の行き先表示幕には、現在使われることのない「深草」幕が入っている。
sen.e: Perhaps being a vestige of the era, the destinaiton-displaying cloths include the sign of "For Fukakusa"that is not used now.
Perhaps being a vestige of the era, the destination-displaying cloths include the sign of "For Fukakusa," which is no longer used.
Perhaps being a vestige of the era, the destination-displaying cloths include the sign of 'For Fukakusa,' which is no longer used.

sen.j: 深草駅までの列車は鴨東線開業前まで存在していた。
sen.e: Trains up to Fukakusa Station were operated until the Oto Line started its operation.
Trains up to Fukakusa Station were operated until the Oto Line started its operation.
Trains up to Fukakusa Station were operated until the Oto Line started its operation.

sen.j: 朝・夕ラッシュ時は大半の普通列車がK特急・特急・急行の待避を行う。
sen.e: Most of the local trains in the morning and evening rush hours wait on the side tracks to make the K-limited express trains, limted express trains and express trains run through this station.

Most of the local trains in the morning and evening rush hours wait on the side tracks in order to allow the K-limited express trains, limited express trains and express trains to run through the station.

Most of the local trains in the morning and evening rush hours wait on the side tracks in order to allow the K-limited express trains, limited express trains and express trains to run through the station.

sen.j: この関係で緩急接続が出来ない事から、丹波橋駅以北からの定期券利用客の中には三条方面へ急ぐ場合、当駅で一旦下車して走って至近の伏見稲荷駅へ向かい、急行に乗り換える者もいる。
sen.e: For this reason, you cannot change from a local train to a faster one here, and therefore, some season ticket users get off a local train here, go to the nearest Fushimi-inari Station and take an express train to get to areas in the direction of Sanjo faster.

Accordingly, one can't change from a local train to a faster one here, and therefore some seasonal ticket users get off a local train here, go to the nearest Fushimi-inari Station and take an express train in order to reach areas in the direction of Sanjo more quickly.

Accordingly, one can't change from a local train to a faster one here, and therefore some seasonal ticket users get off a local train here, run to the nearest Fushimi-inari Station and take an express train in order to reach areas in the direction of Sanjo more quickly.

sen.j: 当駅で待避を行う場合、特急・急行に2本まとめて抜かれる場合が多く、停車時間が非常に長いためである（2003年9月以前は、日中でも普通列車は特急・急行にまとめて抜かれていた）。
sen.e: This is because two faster trains, a limited express train and an express train, usually run through this station while a local train waits here, making the waiting time significantly long (before September of 2003, local trains had to make such a long wait even in the day time).

This is because two faster trains--a limited express train and an express train--usually run through this station while a local train waits here, making the waiting time significantly long (before September 2003, local trains had to wait even in the daytime).

This is because two faster trains--a limited express train and an express train--usually run through this station while a local train waits here, making the waiting time significantly long (before September 2003, local trains had to wait even in the daytime).

sen.j: 当駅の待避線（1番線・4番線）は8両編成の列車が待避可能であるが、ホーム有効長は7両分しかない。
sen.e: Eight-car trains can wait on the side tracks (tracks 1 and 4), but the effective lengths of the platforms are that for seven-car tarins.
Eight-car trains can wait on the sidetracks (tracks 1 and 4), but the effective lengths of the platforms are sufficient for seven-car trains.
Eight-car trains can wait on the sidetracks (tracks 1 and 4), but the effective lengths of the platforms are only sufficient for seven-car trains.

sen.j: これは当駅のホームの幅が狭く、橋上駅舎への階段で1両分のホームの用地が犠牲になっており、またホーム南側も京都府道201号中山稲荷線の古い跨線橋が跨っているため8両編成分のホームに延伸できないからである。
sen.e: The reasons for making it impossible to extend the platforms for eight-car trains are as follows: With the lenghts of the platforms limitted, some spaces on them whose length corresponds to that of a train car were used for constructing the stairs between each platform and the over-track station house, and an overpass of the Nakayama Inari road of Kyoto Prefecture road 201 exists on the south side of the platforms.

The platforms can't be extended to accommodate eight-car trains because, with the lengths of the platforms being limited, some spaces on them whose length corresponds to that of a train car were used in constructing the stairs between each platform and the over-track station house, and an overpass of the Nakayama Inari Road of Kyoto Prefectural Road 201 exists on the south side of the platforms.

The platforms can't be extended to accommodate eight-car trains because, with the lengths of the platforms being limited, some spaces on them whose length corresponds to that of a train car were used in constructing the stairs between each platform and the over-track station house, and an overpass of the Nakayama-Inari Line of Kyoto Prefectural Route 201 exists on the south side of the platforms.
sen.cmt: 府道→Prefectural Route としました。

sen.j: なお、当駅以外の京都市内の京阪本線の駅では、東福寺駅・伏見桃山駅も駅の前後が踏切に挟まれており、大規模な工事を行わない限りは、中書島駅以北の準急・普通のみ停車駅の8連対応は困難である。
sen.e: Of the stations on the Keihan Main Line in Kyoto City, Tofukuji Station and Fushimi Momoyam Station has a similar problem, with a crossing placed at each end of the platforms of these stations, and therefore, it is impossible to enable Chushojima Station and the stations, located further north, where only semi-express trains and local trains stop, to support eight-car trains, as long as a large-scale construction work is not done.

Of the stations on the Keihan Main Line in Kyoto City, Tofukuji Station and Fushimi Momoyama Station have a similar problem, with a crossing placed at each end of the platforms of those stations, but without large-scale construction it would be impossible to enable Chushojima Station and the stations located further north, where only semi-express trains and local trains stop, to support eight-car trains.

Of the stations on the Keihan Main Line in Kyoto City, Tofukuji Station and Fushimi-momoyama Station have a similar problem, with a crossing placed at each end of the platforms of those stations, but without large-scale construction it would be impossible to enable Chushojima Station and the stations located further north, where only semi-express trains and local trains stop, to support eight-car trains.
sen.cmt: Fushimi-momoyama Station としました（京阪のサイトより）。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 西側入り口前に自転車置き場と有料駐車場がある。
sen.e: A bicycle parking space and a toll parking lot are located in front of the west entrance to the station.
A space for bicycle parking and a toll parking lot are located in front of the west entrance to the station.
A space for bicycle parking and a toll parking lot are located in front of the west entrance to the station.

sen.j: 東側入り口前に飲食店が数件ある。
sen.e: Several eating and/or drinking places are located in front of the east entrance to the station.
Several eating and/or drinking establishments are located in front of the station's east entrance.
Several eating and/or drinking establishments are located in front of the station's east entrance.

sen.e: Inari Station (on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West)): about three-minute walk in the north-northeast direction from this station
Inari Station (on the Nara Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West)) is an approximately three-minute walk in the north-northeast direction from this station.
Inari Station (on the Nara Line of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West)) is an approximately three-minute walk in the north-northeast direction from this station.

sen.j: 深草バスストップは当駅からも1km前後の距離であるが、最寄は藤森駅である。
sen.e: The Fukakusa bus stop is around 1 km apart from this station but is nearest to Fujinomori Station.
The Fukakusa bus stop is located about a kilometer from this station but is nearest to Fujinomori Station.
The Fukakusa bus stop is located about a kilometer from this station but is nearest to Fujinomori Station.

No route bus service is available at Keihan Fukakusa Station.

The nearest bus stop: Ryukoku-daigaku-mae (in front of Ryukoku University) for route buses by the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau

sen.e: This bus stop is not located in front of this station but at a place along Shidan-kaido Road, a five-minute walk from the station.
This bus stop is not located in front of this station but is instead situated along Shidan-kaido Road, a five-minute walk from the station.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）4月15日 稲荷駅として開業。
sen.e: April 15, 1910: Its operation started as Inari Station
April 15, 1910: It began operating as Inari Station.
April 15, 1910: It began operating as Inari Station.

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）12月16日 深草駅に改称。
sen.e: December 16, 1910: Its name was changed to Fukakusa Station.
December 16, 1910: Its name was changed to Fukakusa Station.
December 16, 1910: Its name was changed to Fukakusa Station.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged and this station became a station of Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu (Hankyu Corporation).
October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged, and this station became a facility of Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu (Hankyu Corporation).
October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged, and this station became a facility of Keihanshin Express Electric Railway (Hankyu Corporation).
sen.cmt: 京阪神急行電鉄→Keihanshin Express Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a facility of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a facility of Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1964年（昭和39年）3月15日 駅を現在の位置に移設。
sen.e: March 15, 1949: The station was moved to the present site.
March 15, 1949: The station was relocated to its present site.
March 15, 1964: The station was relocated to its present site.

sen.j: それまでは現在駅の出町柳寄りに駅があった。
sen.e: The former station was placed slightly on the Demachiyanagi side.
The former station was placed slightly on the Demachiyanagi side.
The former station was placed slightly on the Demachiyanagi side.

sen.j: 現在も跡が空き地として残る。
sen.e: The site still remains vacant.
The site remains vacant today.
The site remains vacant today.

sen.j: 1971年（昭和46年）8月15日 橋上駅化。
sen.e: August 15, 1971: The work to build the over-track station house was completed.
August 15, 1971: The work of constructing the over-track station house was completed.
August 15, 1971: The work of constructing the over-track station house was completed.

sen.j: 1980年（昭和55年）3月17日 深草車庫廃止。
sen.e: March 17, 1980: The operation of Fukakusa-shako Depot was discontinued.
March 17, 1980: The operation of Fukakusa-shako Depot was discontinued.
March 17, 1980: The operation of Fukakusa-shako Depot was discontinued.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）2月 ホーム・階段が1メートル拡幅。
sen.e: February, 1988: The widths of the platforms and stairs were expanded by 1m.
February, 1988: The widths of the platforms and stairs were expanded by a meter.
February, 1988: The widths of the platforms and stairs were expanded by a meter.

sen.j: 拡幅用地確保の為に東側に有った留置線2本のうち1本を撤去。
sen.e: To secure the land space for the expansion above, one of the two extra side tracks for keeping trains was removed.
To secure the land area for the expansion above, one of the two extra sidetracks for keeping trains was removed.
To secure the land area for the expansion above, one of the two extra sidetracks for keeping trains was removed.
